caption: Table 1: Test accuracy (%) on five datasets. The best results are highlighted in bold.
description: This table presents the test accuracy results for different noise types (Symmetric, Pairflip, Tridiagonal, Instance) and noise ratios (20%, 40%) across five datasets (MNIST, CIFAR10, CIFAR100, FMNIST, SVHN).  The performance of two methods, Co-teaching and the proposed Sharpness Reduction Interactive Teaching (SRIT), are compared. The best accuracy for each condition is highlighted in bold, showcasing SRIT's superior performance across various datasets and noise conditions.

caption: Table 1: Test accuracy (%) on five datasets. The best results are highlighted in bold.
description: This table presents the test accuracy results achieved by different models (Co-teaching and SRIT) on five benchmark datasets (MNIST, CIFAR10, CIFAR100, FMNIST, and SVHN) under various noise conditions.  Each dataset is subjected to four different noise types (Symmetric, Pairflip, Tridiagonal, Instance) at two noise ratios (20% and 40%). The table highlights the best accuracy for each dataset and noise condition, providing a quantitative comparison of the two algorithms' performance in noisy environments.
